SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.service

Class SupplierScoreCalculator

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.service.SupplierScoreCalculator
public class SupplierScoreCalculator extends Object
Calculates supplier scores based on coverage and success rate for optimized AC_OPEN supplier selection. The scoring formula is: score = coverageCount x successRate - coverageCount: number of requested instruments this supplier supports (from GTNetSupplierDetail) - successRate: entitiesUpdated / entitiesSent from recent exchange logs (default 1.0 if no history) Suppliers are sorted by score descending, then priority ascending, with random shuffle for ties within the same score+priority bucket. Note: This calculator is only used for AC_OPEN servers. AC_PUSH_OPEN servers continue to use the priority+random algorithm in BaseGTNetExchangeService.getSuppliersByPriorityWithRandomization().

      Calculates the score for a supplier.
      Parameters:
      idGtNet - the supplier ID
      coverageCount - the number of requested instruments this supplier supports

      Gets the success rate for a supplier.
      Parameters:
      idGtNet - the supplier ID
      Returns:
      the success rate (0.0 to 1.0), or DEFAULT_SUCCESS_RATE if no data

    • sortSuppliersByScore

      public List<GTNet> sortSuppliersByScore(List<GTNet> suppliers, GTNetExchangeKindType exchangeKind, SupplierInstrumentFilter filter, Set<Integer> requestedInstrumentIds)
      Sorts AC_OPEN suppliers by score (descending), priority (ascending), with random shuffle for ties.
      Parameters:
      suppliers - list of suppliers to sort
      exchangeKind - the exchange kind for priority lookup
      filter - the instrument filter for coverage calculation
      requestedInstrumentIds - the set of instruments being requested
      Returns:
      sorted list of suppliers
